glsa.title: HylaFAX: Remote code exploit in hylafax
glsa.synopsis: A format bug condition allows a remote attacjer to execute arbitrary code as the root user.

background.p: HylaFAX is a popular client-server fax package.

description.p: During a code review of the hfaxd server, the SuSE Security Team discovered a format bug condition that allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code as the root user. However, the bug cannot be triggered in the default hylafax configuration.

impact.p: A remote attacker could execute arbitrary code with root privileges.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: Users are encouraged to perform an 'emerge sync' and upgrade the package to the latest available version. Vulnerable versions of hylafax have been removed from portage. Specific steps to upgrade:
resolution.code: # emerge sync # emerge -pv '>=net-misc/hylafax-4.1.8' # emerge '>=net-misc/hylafax-4.1.8' # emerge clean
